private_information: I am responsible for the left peg.
My peg contains disks from top to bottom: A, B, C, D, E.
left_agent.goal: Report the contents and ordering of the left peg to the orchestrator.

private_information: I am responsible for the middle peg.
middle_agent.goal: Report the contents and ordering of the middle peg to the orchestrator.

private_information: I am responsible for the right peg.
right_agent.goal: Report the contents and ordering of the right peg to the orchestrator.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate peg reports and produce a PDDL domain and problem for the Tower of Hanoi instance with 5 disks targeting the FastDownwards solver.

public_information: This is a Tower of Hanoi puzzle with three pegs named left, middle, and right.
There are 5 disks labeled A B C D E from smallest A to largest E.
Initially the left peg has disks from top to bottom A B C D E and the other pegs are empty.
The goal is to move all disks to the right peg maintaining the same top to bottom order A through E.
Only one disk can be moved at a time.
A larger disk cannot be placed on top of a smaller disk.

report.system_prompt: You are an observer agent for a single peg. Provide a concise factual report of the peg contents in order from top to bottom. Do not produce PDDL or planning code.
report.prompt: Your name is left_agent. Using your private information and the environment public information, report the exact contents of the left peg in order from top to bottom. Provide only the contents and their order.

report.system_prompt: You are an observer agent for a single peg. Provide a concise factual report of the peg contents in order from top to bottom. Do not produce PDDL or planning code.
report.prompt: Your name is middle_agent. Using your private information and the environment public information, report the exact contents of the middle peg in order from top to bottom. Provide only the contents and their order.

report.system_prompt: You are an observer agent for a single peg. Provide a concise factual report of the peg contents in order from top to bottom. Do not produce PDDL or planning code.
report.prompt: Your name is right_agent. Using your private information and the environment public information, report the exact contents of the right peg in order from top to bottom. Provide only the contents and their order.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in PDDL and in preparing planning tasks for the FastDownwards solver. Using the peg reports, produce a complete PDDL domain and a complete PDDL problem that model the Tower of Hanoi instance with 5 disks and three pegs. Include types, predicates, and actions required to move a single disk between pegs while enforcing the constraint that a larger disk cannot be placed on a smaller disk. Ensure the PDDL is compatible with FastDownwards conventions and include any necessary numeric or typing details for that solver. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Integrate the reports from the three peg agents to build a PDDL domain and problem for the global goal: move all disks from the left peg to the right peg preserving the ordering. Use the peg reports to construct the initial state and verify the goal state. Keep actions explicit and ensure the PDDL is directly usable with FastDownwards. Enclose the domain and the problem in the specified tags.
